original_title: Sri Lanka to plug gaps in anti-money laundering, counter terror financing rules
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s cabinet of ministers had approved a proposal made by President Ranil Wickremesinghe to plug ‘identified weaknesses’ in the country’s anti-money laundering and terrorist financing framework, spokesman Bandula Gunawardana said.
The measures are in the Anti-Money Laundering and Countering the Financing of Terrorism National Policy for 2023-2028
Sri Lanka is due to face the third annual mutual evaluation by the Asia Pacific Regional Group on Money Laundering from March 2025.
The Financial Action Task Force is an intergovernmental body that sets international standards to prevent money laundering and terrorist financing.
The Financial Action Task Force has introduced 40 recommendations to be implemented by all countries, the statement said. (Colombo/Aug08/2023)
